landingPages.title: Is Milk Keto Friendly?
landingPages.searchDescription: Milk as a beverage is not considered keto friendly for weight loss. This is mainly due to a single cup of milk containing approximately 12 grams of net carbs. Just 2 cups a day will hit the daily carb limit. Also carbohydrates in liquid form is fast absorbing, and milk with low fat content can raise blood sugar and insulin quickly. However, this does not mean you cannot drink milk on a ketogenic diet.
landingPages.intro:
Milk as a beverage is not considered keto friendly for weight loss. This is mainly due to a single cup of milk containing approximately 12 grams of net carbs. Just 2 cups a day will hit the daily carb limit. Also carbohydrates in liquid form is fast absorbing, and milk with low fat content can raise blood sugar and insulin quickly. However, this does not mean you cannot drink milk on a ketogenic diet.

In this article we take a nuanced look at milk, and techniques allow us to enjoy this beverage while on a ketogenic diet.

searchImage.credit: Photo by ROBIN WORRALL on Unsplash

landingPages.title: Coffee on Keto: The Science of Coffee on the Keto Diet
landingPages.pageTitle: Coffee on Keto: The Science of Coffee on the Keto Diet
landingPages.searchDescription: Here we explore coffee as more than just your morning wake up beverage. It has numerous health benefits, how it is synergistic with the keto diet and how to properly use this like a powerful elixir to improve your life and reach your goals.
landingPages.intro: Here we explore coffee as more than just your morning wake up beverage. It has numerous health benefits, how it is synergistic with the keto diet and how to properly use this like a powerful elixir to improve your life and reach your goals.
